question.text: Observe the diagram and choose the correct answer.

options.text: 'A' undergoes splitting at PSI and e<sup>- </sup>are transported through iron and copper-containing carriers.

x' and y' are formed on the stroma side of the thylakoid membrane, e<sup>-</sup> are transported through iron and copper-containing carriers and transport of H<sup>+</sup> through photosystems causes transfer of e<sup>-</sup> across the thylakoid membrane.
'A' undergoes splitting at PSI, transport of H<sup>+</sup> through photosystems causes transfer of e<sup>-</sup> across the thylakoid membrane.
x' and y' are formed on the stroma side of the thylakoid membrane and e<sup>-</sup> are transported through iron and copper-containing carriers.

solution.text: In the above Z‐scheme, x and y are ADP and NADP. NADP reductase is present in the grana thylakoid towards stroma. It breaks down the proton concentration gradient to produce ATP through CF0−CF1. Photolysis of H2O occurs in the lumen and again proton concentration gradient is established along the thylakoid membrane.
